title: This Aircraft Boneyard Timelapse Is Eerily Beautiful
text:
This Aircraft Boneyard Timelapse Is Eerily Beautiful 
The sun has set on these aging vehicles. GIF By Chris Clarke Feb 1, 2017 When the military decides the time has come to retire a plane, its resent place is usually out in the desert, somewhere in the 2,600 acres of the Aerospace Maintenance and Regeneration Group at Davis-Monthan Air Force Base. This is the " Boneyard ." The arid Arizona climate is ideal for preserving airplane components, in the event the military decides it suddenly needs an old plane or its parts. This enchanting timelapse reveals a desolate scene and a stunning backdropâ€”the hope of renewal somehow captured among the sad slate of discarded aircraft. Enjoy a tour of massive cargo airplanes, light jet trainers, and the empty shells of once-deadly helicopters.
